history.content: You could look into CS186 or CS100. You're right about none of those classes being doable with your current schedule.

children.subject:
Well, as a transfer student, you have limited time and cannot expect to fit everything in your schedule, unfortunately. I guess you would need to prioritize and take only those that are most aligned with your future goals. I could give you some advice regarding your course choices, but ultimately its your call:

- 170: must-take

- 169: I've heard that if you do an internship, you don't really need to take this class as you end up learning the skills with time in industry

- 188: cool class but probably the least useful in terms of career relevance, unless you want to do AI/ML

- 189: same as 188, but has additional overheads of being challenging, math-heavy and requires ee126/127 as prereqs.

- 186, 162: Relevant/essential for industry/systems/SWE in general
- Only if you plan to do something graphics-related in the future, take 184. And I guess you will necessarily have to take it next semester, since it is only offered in the Spring

- 100: Only if you wanna do something DS-related. Not particularly useful.
Awesome! Thank you so much for the help!

Original poster here. Thanks for the advice! As a followup question: so say now that next semester I take 170, 188, and 186/100. Then I'm planning on taking CS189 and a tech elective Fall 2019. So, since that will be my last semester here, does this mean that I probably won't be able to take 162, 184, or 169?

history.content: I'm a CS transfer student currently in my third semester here. I still have two more semester to go after this one, and I was wondering what classes I should take in order to have a workload that is manageable. In my last two semesters, I need to take 5 upper divs and 1 tech elective, so I was going to take 3 upper divs next semester. So far, I'm planning on taking CS170 and CS188, but I'm not sure what I should take for a third upper div class. I'm most interested in CS162, CS184, and CS 169. However, if none of those classes are doable with my current schedule, then I'm wondering what I should take instead. To be clear, I'm not trying to find a way to make next semester easy. Instead, I just want to make sure that I can create a schedule in a way such that I can get the most out of all three classes. Thanks!
history.subject: Workload Advice: CS170, CS188, and third CS Upper Div
